questions.question: What is the term used for the living organisms in an ecosystem?
Which of the following is a biotic factor in the environment?
What is the process by which plants release water vapor into the atmosphere?
Which of the following is an abiotic component of the environment?
What is the main source of energy for all living organisms?
What do you call a group of ecosystems that share similar climates and organisms?
Which type of relationship is depicted when one organism benefits while the other is harmed?
Which process in the nitrogen cycle converts atmospheric nitrogen into a usable form for plants?
What is a food chain?
options: A complex network of feeding relationships
A single pathway of energy flow
The total biomass in an ecosystem

questions.question: What is a food web?
options: A complex interconnection of food chains
The amount of energy available at each trophic level

questions.question: What do ecological pyramids represent?
What is the term for the accumulation of heavy metals in fish in the Edulabad water reservoir?
Which of the following pollutants is a major cause of acid rain?
What is the primary cause of habitat destruction?
Which of the following is a renewable resource?
Which gas is primarily responsible for the greenhouse effect?
What term describes the variety of life in an ecosystem?
Which type of energy is produced by burning fossil fuels?
What role do decomposers play in an ecosystem?
Which of the following is NOT a consequence of pollution?
